headline.main: Personal Health; Caffeine, a Two-Faced Drug, No Matter How You Take It

docs.lead_paragraph: "LIGHT, no sugar" ... "Regular" ... "Black." ... Few who have grown up in the Eastern part of this country need to be told that these orders refer to the all-American drink--coffee. More than half the world's coffee beans are brewed here. The average adult American consumes 16 pounds, or approximately 800 cups, each year of this brown, nonnutritive liquid extracted from the beans of Coffee arabica and related species.
